title: while let doesn't work as expected with mutex
body:
I tried this code: ```rust use std::sync::Mutex; fn main() { let lock = Mutex::new(vec![1; 10]); while let Some(x) = lock.lock().unwrap().pop() { lock.lock().unwrap().push(x); println!("the lock works as expected"); } } ``` I expected to see this happen: *It can print the message, which means lock it again successfully* Instead, this happened: *Nothing is print, which means dead lock* ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (b1496c6e6 2020-10-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: b1496c6e606dd908dd651ac2cce89815e10d7fc5 commit-date: 2020-10-18 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ```
